Vaalpark Articon is a unique school in Sasolburg (Fezile Dabi / Northern Free State) where the arts and academics are successfully combined.
The school is a school of excellence that improves the quality of life of all learners from all backgrounds who possess talents in arts by providing quality life-long education and training.

To operate a prestigious yet accessible school of excellence for the arts that delivers an effective educational system that works towards the overall development of young South-Africans through the arts in a dedicated professional manner.

In Grade 8 and 9 (GET - Phase) learners take the normal nine OBE subjects on offer as prescribed by the National Department of Education. The nine OBE subjects are: Afrikaans, English, Arts and Culture, Social Sciences, Economic and Management Sciences, Life Orientation, Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Technology. Here at Vaalpark Articon Grade 8 and 9 learners have to choose an extra tenth subject. A learner may choose one from the following list:

In Grade 10-12 (FET - Phase) it is compulsory for learners to take the following four subjects: Afrikaans, English / Engels, Mathematics or Mathematical Literacy, Life Orientation. Learners will then have to choose three subjects of which one must be an Art subject from the following list in order to account for the minimum of seven subjects.
